options.name: router
options.description: The configurations required for router to route the traffic from different clients to services.

params.name: listenerHost
params.description: Host for the listener of Router.

params.name: securedListenerHost
params.description: Host for the secured listener of Router.

params.name: listenerPort
params.description: Port for the listener of Router.

params.name: securedListenerPort
params.description: Port for secured listener of Router.

params.name: systemHost
params.description: The system hostname for system API resources (eg: /testkey and /health).

params.name: clusterTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The time duration that the Router will wait for an upstream TCP connection to be established.

params.name: enforcerResponseTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The timeout for response coming from enforcer to route per API request.

options.name: router.connectionTimeout
options.description: Timeouts managed by the Envoy (Router) connection manager in Choreo Connect.

params.name: requestTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The time duration that the Router waits for the request to be received by the upstream, starting from the time it was initiated at the client.

params.name: requestHeadersTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The time duration that the Router waits for the request headers to be received by the upstream, starting from the time it was initiated at the client.

params.name: streamIdleTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The time duration that the Router will allow a stream to exist with no upstream or downstream activity. This timeout is applied to regular requests/responses as well as streaming requests/responses, and can be overridden by router.upstream.timeouts.routeIdleTimeoutInSeconds

params.name: idleTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The time at which a downstream connection will be terminated if there are no active streams.

options.name: router.upstream.timeouts
options.description: Timeout settings related to routes. This will be applicable globally for all the APIs in Choreo Connect.

params.name: routeTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: This is the value that gets overridden by the timeout set at the endpoint level.

params.name: maxRouteTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: Maximum value accepted as the endpoint level timeout. If a larger timeout is set as the Endpoint Level Upstream Timeout, this value will replace the provided Endpoint Level Upstream Timeout.

params.name: routeIdleTimeoutInSeconds
params.description: The backend (upstream) connection idle timeout. The time duration that the requestâ€™s stream may be idle.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Time in seconds to wait for a health check response.

params.name: interval
params.description: Interval between health checks in seconds.

params.name: unhealthyThreshold
params.description: Number of unhealthy health checks required before a host is marked as unhealthy.

params.name: healthyThreshold
params.description: Number of healthy health checks required before a host is marked as healthy.

options.name: router.keystore
options.description: The configurations of key store used in Choreo Connect Router

params.name: certPath
params.description: Path of the certificate of the Adaptor

params.name: keyPath
params.description: Path of the private key of the Adaptor

params.name: enabled
params.description: Enable CORS configurations globally for all endpoints and APIs deployed in Choreo Connect Router

params.name: allowOrigins
params.description: Allowed origins. set this to [*] allow all origins.

params.name: allowMethods
params.description: The content for the access-control-allow-methods header.

params.name: allowHeaders
params.description: The content for the access-control-allow-headers header.

params.name: exposeHeaders
params.description: The content for the access-control-expose-headers header.

params.name: allowCredentials
params.description: Specifies whether the resource allows credentials.

options.name: router.upstream.retry
options.description: The configurations for the Choreo Connect router when retrying upstream clusters.

params.name: maxRetryCount
params.description: Maximum value that can be set as the count within the Endpoint Level Retry configuration.

params.name: baseIntervalInMillis
params.description: Base interval for the Envoy's (Router's) exponential retry back off algorithm

params.name: statusCodes
params.description: HTTP status codes that would switch on the retry mechanism when an Endpoint Level Retry configuration is set. The list here is used when the retry configuration is set via the WSO2 API-M UI or when all given status codes are out of range.

options.name: router.upstream.tls
options.description: The configurations for SSL configuration related to the backend connection in Choreo Connect.

params.name: minimumProtocolVersion
params.description: Minimum TLS protocol version.

params.name: maximumProtocolVersion
params.description: Maximum TLS protocol version.

params.name: ciphers
params.default: ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256, ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256, ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA, ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA, AES128-GCM-SHA256, AES128-SHA, ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384, ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384, ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA, ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA, AES256-GCM-SHA384, AES256-SHA
params.description: If specified, the TLS listener will only support the specified [cipher list]() when negotiating TLS 1.0-1.2 (this setting has no effect when negotiating TLS 1.3)

params.name: trustedCertPath
params.description: Path to trusted certificates

params.name: verifyHostName
params.description: Enable/Disable Verifying host name

params.name: disableSslVerification
params.description: Disable SSL verification

options.name: router.payloadPassingToEnforcer
options.description: The configurations for the Choreo Connect router when passing request payload to the enforcer.

params.name: passRequestPayload
params.description: Enable/Disable request payload passing.

params.name: maxRequestBytes
params.description: Maximum allowed size of a message body in bytes.

params.name: allowPartialMessage
params.description: If enabled, request payload will be buffered until maxRequestBytes is reached.

params.name: packAsBytes
params.description: If enabled request payload will be passed as raw bytes to the enforcer. Disabling this will provide UTF-8 string request payload to the enforcer.
